result.execSummary:
The defendant Kassandra J. DeClark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full time employment/30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.

DNA Sample.
Completion of AODA deemed by agent and follow through with treatment recommendations.
Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Counseling deemed beneficial by agent.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with any other sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kassandra J. DeClark

records.addlTxt: of Proceeding - Plea/Sentencing Hearing Partial Transcript - Held 4-26-22

02:34 PM Defendant Kassandra J. DeClark in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Defendant Kassandra J. DeClark in custody from Taycheedah Correctional Inst.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kassandra J. DeClark appeared by video means with Attorney. All parties via zoom.   Def. can hear all parties and would like to proceed with zoom. Waiver of p.h. needs to be completed.  State gives plea agreement, Information filed, plea to charge, 4 years prison, 2 years in 2 years extend concurrent cots, DNA Surcharge/Sample, AODA and follow through,   Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  Maintain full time employment/school 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for. Counseling deemed by agent.  Atty Jansen and def. agree with plea agreement.    Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing and Court goes over waiver form. .  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and bind over. Information Filed.  Atty Jansen has copy of Information and waives reading.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed and gone over with def.  Def. understands charge and penalties.  Ct 1 Possess Firearm, no contest plea.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & JT rights.  Def. understands elements. Def. admits prior conviction. Def. advised of possible deportation if not US citizen.  Atty Jansen is satisfied.  Factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to Possess Firearm.  State ask Court to adopt joint recommendation and gives sentencing remarks. Atty Jansen gives sentencing remarks.  Court gives ruling and orders and orders on Ct. 1 - 4 years prison, 2 years initial confinement, 2 years extend supervision, concurrent with any other sentence, costs, $250DNA Surcharge/Sample, Completion of  AODA deemed by agent and follow through with treatment recommendations, Maintain Absolute Sobriety, Maintain full time employment/30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for, Counseling deemed beneficial by agent. 31 days credit. Def. is eligible for both programs.  Def. advised of firearm and voting rights. Def. advised of postconviction rights. DNA, Voting & Appeal form Atty Jansen will get signature and file with court.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kassandra J. DeClark
Current: W6898 County Road T, Pearson, WI 54462 United States  (Effective: 02-01-2022)
Prior: 6898 County Road T, Pearson, WI 54462
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. No possession of dangerous weapons.

01:43 PM Defendant Kassandra J. DeClark in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Defendant Kassandra J. DeClark in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kassandra J. DeClark appeared by video means with Attorney. All Parties via zoom.  Atty Jansen has copy of complaint, waives reading and waives time limits for p.h.  Atty Jansen filed a bond modification.  Court reviews bail/bond modification.  State has reviewed bail/bond recommendation and hasn't been able to talk to Dept of Corrections. Jail just received paperwork.  State stipulates to bond modification.  Court will order $2,000 signature bond. Def. agrees to waive time limits for p.h. Court accepts waiver of time limits for p.h.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons.

01:07 PM in Room 203.  Defendant Kassandra J. DeClark in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kassandra J. DeClark appeared by video means. All appearances are by Zoom. Def. does not have copy of complaint, advised she would receive one.   Def. advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. on probation hold. State heard on bond, recommends $2,000 cash bond with conditions  no illegal use or possession of controlled substances and no possession of dangerous weapons. Def. heard on bond. The Court orders $2,000 cash bond with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
